fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When ref sync (fork syncing) applies upstream changes to forks, if any refs are updated and then quickly deleted the fetch can fail because the ref no longer exists. The ref sync code includes handling for this case, to log a clear message without spamming the logs with unnecessary stack traces. Git 2.21+ include textual changes which break that handling, however.

_Functionality is not impacted by this issue._ Ref sync produces identical results with Git 2.21+ to Git 2.20 and earlier. The difference is that update-then-delete scenarios on Git 2.21+ will produce more verbose logging.

h3. Environment

 * Git 2.21

h3. Workaround

No workaround is available or necessary. There is no _functional impact_ from this issue; it's purely cosmetic (logging).
fields.summary: Git 2.21+: Ref sync produces verbose logging when requested ref cannot be found

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Overriding the default cache-control header (Cache-Control: no-transform, max-age=600, stale-if-error=86400, stale-while-revalidate=86400 ) and if max-age, stale-if-error, stale-while-revalidate are not set for Jira, then it causes the smart commits to stop working.

This issue is noticed in environment where Jira is running behind IIS where ASP.NET is registered with IIS and the application pool doesn't have the "No Managed code" selected. But this is not limited to IIS , if the proxy overrides the cache-control as mentioned above, this issue may occur.

*Note:* This will affect *all remote events that Bitbucket publishes* if the consumer that subscribes to those events is behind a proxy that is overriding the {{Cache-Control}} header in the response. It is not specific to just Jira and Smart commits but all Bitbucket events Jira is interested in and even Bamboo events such as branch created, branch changed, pull request events etc.
 
h3. Environment

Bitbucket Server has an application link with a Jira instance which is running behind proxy and proxy is overriding Cache-control header.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example with IIS
 * Configure IIS in front of Jira
 * Register ASP.NET for IIS with a command as below
{code:java}
cd C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319
 C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319>dism /online /enable-feature /all /featurename:IIS-ASPNET45 
{code}

 * Find the Application pool that site is using and change the .NET CLR Version to .NET CLR Version 4.x.x.x
 * Create application Link with Bitbucket
 * Restart Bitbucket to make sure cache is cleared
 * Test smart commit
 * To check the cache-control run curl with verbose and verify the header
{code:java}
curl -v http://<JIRA-URL>/rest/remote-event-consumer/1/capabilities
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Smart commit will work as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Smart commits stop working and following appear in log. As you can see consumable by is empty
{noformat}
2019-05-07 11:31:42,217 DEBUG [AtlassianEvent::thread-2]  c.a.e.r.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher RemoteEvent com.atlassian.devstatus.IssueChangedEvent@51802add[issueKeys=[JRA-227],sourceId=<null>,sourceUrl=<null>] consumable by []
2019-05-07 11:31:42,217 DEBUG [AtlassianEvent::thread-4]  c.a.e.r.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher RemoteEvent 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * [Bypass a reverse proxy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-bypass-a-reverse-proxy-or-ssl-in-application-links-719095724.html] and recreate the application link.
 * Change the cache-control setting in proxy to not override it.
 * For IIS, make sure the application for the site is using "No Managed code"
fields.summary: Overriding cache-control header for Jira causes smart commits (and other remote events) to stop working

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

Add the ability for pull requests to be automatically declined by the system if they have had no recent activity.
h3. Ideas
 * the amount of time could be configurable (e.g. N days, N weeks, months, year, ..)
 * the configuration could be a project level setting (overridable at the repository level)
 * the system could take ownership for the decline action
 * the time based decline could override any other factors keeping the pull request open
 * changes to the target branch shouldn't count as activity to the pull request

h3. Why

 This is potentially useful functionality for both a developer's user experience (less clutter in PR list/dashboard etc., pseudo reminder to either readdress outstanding work or move it to won't do) and also for the system admin (every open pull request is rescoped whenever either the source or target branch changes, so this could mean redundant rescopes if there are many old/not worked on PRs targetting a hot branch like {{master}}).
fields.summary: Decline pull requests not updated in configurable time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* There is a PR (PR1) containing two commits CA and CB. 
* There is a second PR (PR2) containing only CA. 
* Both PRs have master as target.

If you now merge PR2, the activity stream in PR1 will say that CA was removed by you from PR1. 

This can cause confussion to the users working on PR1 as they may wonder why a commit was removed from that PR.

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve messaging in the activity stream to "Removed from PR since it is already in the target branch".
fields.summary: Improve PR activity stream messaging when commit gets removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when an open PR which source does not contain any commits that are not on the target branch, it gets automatically declined. When that happens, the user that appears as the one declining the PR may have not involved in that PR at all. Their name appears as the one declining the PR as they were the ones triggering the changed that caused the source and destination branches pointing at the same commit. That change could have been, for example, merging another PR.

This can cause confusion to the user as they may wonder why 'X' user decided to decline the PR.

h3. Suggested Solution

If a PR is declined automatically because the content of the PR does not contribute to the target any longer, it should clearly state this in the UI something like: "PR declined as it no longer contributes to the target branch".
fields.summary: Improve PR activity stream messaging when it gets declined automatically

fields.description:
If signed commits are required across multiple repositories, pull-request merge commits that exist in a new PR will not be allowed to merge due to the hook. For example:

# Have Repo A create two forks, B and C
# Merge a PR from B into C
# Attempt to merge C into A

A will not allow the merge since the merge commit is not signed.

If Bitbucket could sign its own commits, it would allow for this type of workflow where work is being done in forks rather than branches in the same repository.
fields.summary: Ability for Bitbucket to sign its own server generated commits

fields.summary: External program server side hooks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to swap the location of a repo and its fork, deleting the fork after swapping can cause the original repo to be deleted. This is caused by a UI problem which causes the user to think the repository delete did not function correctly, resulting in a second delete attempt which deletes the original repo.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) Issue reproduced on both Bitbucket Server 5.15.0 and 6.3.0
 # Create three projects PROJ-A, PROJ-B, PROJ-C
 # Create repo in PROJ-A: PROJ-A/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A/my-repo (original)
 ** PROJ-B (empty)
 ** PROJ-C (empty)
 # Move repo to PROJ-B: PROJ-B/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A (empty)
 ** PROJ-B/my-repo (original)
 ** PROJ-C (empty)
 # Fork repo back to PROJ-A (uncheck 'Enable fork syncing'): PROJ-A/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A/my-repo (fork)
 ** PROJ-B/my-repo (original)
 ** PROJ-C (empty)
 # Move original repo to PROJ-C: PROJ-C/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A/my-repo (fork)
 ** PROJ-B (empty)
 ** PROJ-C/my-repo (original)
 # Move fork to PROJ-B: PROJ-B/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A (empty)
 ** PROJ-B/my-repo (fork)
 ** PROJ-C/my-repo (original)
 # Move original repo to PROJ-A: PROJ-A/my-repo
 ** PROJ-A/my-repo (original)
 ** PROJ-B/my-repo (fork)
 ** PROJ-C (empty)
 # Delete fork repo PROJ-B/my-repo
 ** Selecting 'Delete repository' will bring up the confirmation dialog

h3. Expected Results

Fork repo is deleted, and the user is returned back to the project
h3. Actual Results

Selecting 'Delete' will appear to run, but then returns to the fork repo's settings rather than the project view
 * (!) This is when the fork is deleted, but to the user it looks like the delete did not work for some reason
 * The original repo still exists at this point

Selecting 'Delete repository' again will bring up the confirmation dialog
 * Selecting 'Delete' will now appear to perform the normal delete action and return to the project view (in this case PROJ-B)
 * (x) This is when the original repo is deleted

h3. Notes
 * This does not occur when the repo is just moved, then forked, then the fork is deleted. The swap is required to cause the original repo to be deleted.
 * This may be due to the alias table added by: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-3751

h3. Workaround

Prior to deletion of the fork, ensure that repository is moved to a new/unused location.
fields.summary: Deleting repository fork after moving repository and fork can delete original repository

fields.description:
While Bitbucket is in maintenance mode reading and writing with git is not possible. Why is der no chance to allow reading processes for the git repo?

I suggest, that it would be great to allow read permission for git repos while Bitbucket is in maintenance mode.
fields.summary: Bitbucket should allow read permission to git repos while locked

fields.description:
My colleagues and I have started making heavy use of the pull request feature of Bitbucket. One frustration we've discussed is the difficulty in determining which repo we're currently working on, within all PR-related pages, emails, Etc.

 

When creating a PR for a given feature/bugfix branch, we rarely do so on a single repo; a feature more commonly spans multiple repos, and it would be nice to be able to quickly determine which repo we're currently working on when creating and reviewing PRs, without having to look up in the URL of the browser, or subject line of the email. It's just not obvious enough.
fields.summary: Add repo name label to all pull request components

fields.description:
If you query the /users/user/repos/repo endpoint on Bitbucket and the repository was moved, it will redirect the request and find it. Currently this logic is not in place for the /projects/~user/repos/repo endpoint, giving a 500 status if you query a repository that was moved.

We'd like for a similar logic to be applied for the /projects/~user/repos/repo endpoint.
fields.summary: Please add a rule on the redirect logic that covers the /projects/~user/repos/repo endpoint.

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability of having a list of what the Integrity Checker identified as requiring action after it runs and then have the option to select what should be acted upon.

The requirement should be something like:
 * Provide a list of the differences between database and filesystem, ideally as a text log
 * if possible, select those differences we'd like the integrity checker to rectify (which may need a GUI with checkboxes or a formatted text file containing the differences we'd like resolved)
fields.summary: Please add the ability of selecting what the Integrity Checker should rectify after running it

fields.description:
We are using squash commits when merging branches to develop. We would like to verify that the squash commit message follows predefined syntax. 

We tried to apply Merge check -> Common Checks -> Syntax check (Enable the syntax check for each commit message). However, this option does something else - it requires that each commit message in the PR branch passes the syntax check. 

Is there a way how to validate only syntax of the squash commit message?
fields.summary: Allow merge check syntax validation for squash commit message

fields.description: This is related to BAM-15464 a little. Probably not offering SSH as clone method for repositories is much easier to implement than implement BAM-15464
fields.summary: Add config option to allow SSH for Bamboo integration only

fields.description:
When reviewing a PR, you should be able to author multiple comments, come back and tweak them, etc before publishing them to everyone else.

Github has this feature, and it makes a huge difference in my ability to provide coherent PR feedback, and to do so in a way that’s respectful of others’ time and feelings. (E.g. I may answer my own questions before getting to the end of the review, or may discover that one of my own comments was not a good one based on further reading and consideration of the PR). This feature facilitates efficient and constructive reviews.
fields.summary: When reviewing a PR, you should be able to author multiple comments.

fields.description:

 - Bitbucket 5.15
 - AWS, single node DC

When upgrading BB the installer disables all the plugins. Desired behavior is to enable enabled plugins on start.

Or come up in safe mode and ask the administrator to start all the plugins

Or is there an API to enable all the plugins?
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description: As an admin I'd like that the *Allow forks* option would be removed from the repository setings UI when the {{feature.forks}} is set to false.
fields.summary: Remove Allow forks from repository settings when feature.forks is set to false.

fields.description:
When the Data Integrity Check runs and finds a  filesystem <-> database integrity issue, it's being reported in a log file and all the Bitbucket system administrators get the notification in UI.

h3. *Current state:*
If the Integrity Check is not able to fix it or it's not eligible for fix anymore, the information that the integrity check has already been performed is not stored.

Because of that if the Integrity Check runs again, the same database - filesystem discrepancies would be reported again.

h3. *Desired state:*
The Integrity Checker should be aware of discrepancies that have been discovered previously and not report them again, or report them as obsolete/already discovered previously, so they wouldn't need to be investigated again.
fields.summary: Data Integrity Check doesn't store the integrity checks history

fields.description: As a DevOps engineer, I have cases where I need to search across all code to find build tools and scripts that are in need up updates across many projects.   I would like to export search results so that I can further refine the results and create user stories to manage and track the progress of the code updates.
fields.summary: Provide ability to export search results

fields.description:
In [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/bitbucket/reference/api-changelog/] it's mentioned that:
h3. Internal JS events blocked

Events (consumed using {{bitbucket/util/events}}) starting with {{bitbucket.internal}} have never been official API but will no longer be able to be subscribed to and should not be considered stable or part of any official API.

 

I was previously subscribing to these events to handle various user actions in my plugin to trigger specific behaviors. Without these events, [my plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214673/comment-workflow-plugin-for-bitbucket] is less useable. Is there another way to handle the following actions:

"bitbucket.internal.feature.comments.commentDeleted"
"bitbucket.internal.feature.pullRequestActivity.dataLoaded"
"bitbucket.internal.feature.comments.commentAdded"
"bitbucket.internal.feature.comments.commentContainerAdded"
"bitbucket.internal.feature.comments.commentEdited"
"bitbucket.internal.widget.approve-button.adding"
"bitbucket.internal.widget.approve-button.removing"
fields.summary: Open up internal js events in bitbucket

fields.description:
When creating a new pull request there are some checks in the application to minimise the possibility of creating a duplicate of an existing Open pull request.

However, under certain circumstances (for example as mentioned in BSERV-11527) it is still possible to end up with more than one duplicate Open pull request (ie from the same repository and branch, to the same repository and branch).

In such a scenario if a user tries to merge one of the pull requests, the application will in fact:
 * merge them all (with the one where "Merge" was clicked showing the commit and the other(s) showing "remotely merged") - assuming they're not using a squash or rebase strategy
 * (if they _are_ using a squash or rebase strategy) the resulting behavior could be potentially more undesirable

 

The suggestion here is to implement a new Merge Check, which would block a pull request from being merged if it has duplicate open pull requests. This would:
 * draw the user's attention to the duplicate pull requests (as they might not already be aware of them)
 * give the user the opportunity to deal with the duplicates (decline/delete the ones which are duplicates, and then merge the one which is intended)
fields.summary: Merge check for duplicate open pull requests

fields.description:
# In our repository we have very large files. We need to be able to search the entire file not just the first 512 KiB. Many of our searches end with nothing found where something should be found.
 # The should be a way that punctuation can be included.  We have many file and field names with $, # and & that cannot be found.
 # When search term is matches the file name it should be included as found.
fields.summary: Improvments for BitBucket Search

fields.description:
We would like to have the option to give a customer read only access to a project/repository on our bitbucket server. With granting access to our bitbucket server the customer currently gets the possibility to create private repositories. It would be nice to have a real readonly option per group.

 

Under Global Permission an option per group (and user) would be good to disable private repositories.
fields.summary: Allow/disallow private repositories per group

fields.description:
Bitbucket can be configured to send notifications via SMTP. Currently there is no way to specify that an outbound proxy should be used. The JavaMail API specifies properties to be used but these are not set when Bitbucket creates its Session to the Mail server.

|| Property|| Type|| Description||
|mail.smtp.proxy.host|string|Specifies the host name of an HTTP web proxy server that will be used for connections to the mail server.|
|mail.smtp.proxy.port	|string|	Specifies the port number for the HTTP web proxy server. Defaults to port 80.|
|mail.smtp.proxy.user	|string|	Specifies the user name to use to authenticate with the HTTP web proxy server. By default, no authentication is done.|
|mail.smtp.proxy.password	|string|	Specifies the password to use to authenticate with the HTTP web proxy server. By default, no authentication is done.|
|mail.smtp.socks.host	|string|	Specifies the host name of a SOCKS5 proxy server that will be used for connections to the mail server.|
|mail.smtp.socks.port	|string|	Specifies the port number for the SOCKS5 proxy server. This should only need to be used if the proxy server is not using the standard port number of 1080.|

This request is to allow these properties to be configured and used by Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Allow MailService to use proxy for outbound smtp.

fields.description:
Bitbucket is receiving the build results from connected CI systems via [Bitbucket Build REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/bitbucket/how-tos/updating-build-status-for-commits/] using the commit hash and the build key combination to identify the builds.

In case of failed build it's possible to send the update via REST API to identify it as successful. 

However it's impossible to remove the existing build result, which has business impact in case of build configuration mistakes:
# It ran on the wrong agent.
# There was a configuration issue with the agent that needed to be resolved.
# They were actually going for re-run rather than a new build but mistakenly chose the wrong option.
# The incorrect build configuration was in use.
# The build was stopped rather than failed, which results in a failure result appearing in Bitbucket.

It would be good to have the possibility to DELETE the build results via REST API in order to provide the possibility to keep the builds in CI and in Bitbucket in sync.
fields.summary: Provide DELETE support for Bitbucket Build API

h4. Problem
In the UI, an inline dialog (such as pull request icon on top right) can flip direction if number of items exceeds available space.

h4. Workaround
It's possible to add an alignment-static attribute to the <aui-inline-dialog> element, which will prevent it from flipping about when there isn't enough space.

h4. Proposed solution
Update to AUI v 8.2.0 where issue has been fixed (see [\[AUI\-4779\] Update alignment module to allow forced alignment/direction of inline dialog regardless of space \- Ecosystem Jira|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-4779]
fields.summary: Inline dialog flips direction if list of pull requests exceeds visible space

fields.description:
Git 2.18 includes support for detecting "implicit directory renames"; cases where all the files in directory A have moved to directory B and then a new commit introduces a new file in directory A (See the first bullet point in the [release notes|https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.18.0.txt]).

Implicit directory rename support is enabled by default when using {{git merge}}, {{git cherry-pick}} and some invocations of {{git rebase}}, and, at least in all currently-available Git versions that have it, _cannot be disabled_.

When implicit directory rename detection fails, it results in new conflict types Bitbucket Server doesn't know how to handle, resulting in a common ancestor diff being displayed (which doesn't show any conflicts) and a blue banner on the pull request overview with a message like "Bitbucket Server could not create the merge diff for this pull request." Performing a merge (or rebase) locally to resolve conflicts and then pushing to the target branch will allow the system to resume displaying the normal merge-based diff.

As implicit directory rename detection cannot be disabled, the only workaround for preventing these new conflict types is to downgrade to Git 2.17 or earlier where the detection doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Handle "implicit directory rename" conflicts (Git 2.18+)

But there are some cases, where there are commits and an automatic approach can not determine if the changes are needed or not necessary any more.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The analysis of the profiling logs can be more difficult in cases when:
- the same request is performed multiple times
- such request completes very quickly

In the example below, we can see that the {{/rest/api/latest/users}} request completed in over 10 seconds but the individual lines don't sum up to that value:
{noformat}
[10383ms] - "GET /rest/api/latest/users HTTP/1.1"
  [6ms] - ApplicationUser com.atlassian.bitbucket.user.UserService.getUserById(int)
  [7ms] - Page com.atlassian.bitbucket.user.UserService.findGroupsByUser(String,PageRequest)
... 268 lines of
  [1ms] - Page com.atlassian.stash.internal.user.EffectivePermissionDao.findByGroup(String,PageRequest)
{noformat}

What is happening here is that many {{com.atlassian.stash.internal.user.EffectivePermissionDao.findByGroup}} operations are being performed but, because they are faster than 1ms, they are not logged.

The problem with the current implementation is:
- it is not clear why the request is taking that amount of time
- operations faster than 1ms are not logged
- we cannot determine how many fast operations are being performed and how long they take on average

h3. Suggested Solution
Combine adjacent frames for the same timer and:
- show their count
- add a calculate average of each frame

The profiling log above would now look like the following:
{noformat}
[10383ms] - "GET /rest/api/latest/users HTTP/1.1"
  [6ms] - ApplicationUser com.atlassian.bitbucket.user.UserService.getUserById(int)
  [7ms] - Page com.atlassian.bitbucket.user.UserService.findGroupsByUser(String,PageRequest)
[10370ms] [count: 1728, avg: 0.6ms] -  Page com.atlassian.stash.internal.user.EffectivePermissionDao.findByGroup(String,PageRequest)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve profiling logging by combining adjacent frames for the same timer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using a delegated user directory with the option to "Synchronize Group Memberships", all groups associated to the user are synchronized.

Only a small subset of these groups are used to apply permissions to projects, repositories or globally.

This can lead to a significant amount of groups in the system that will have a negative impact on performance (e.g. when loading @ mentions in pull requests).

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a filter for the groups to be imported.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to choose which groups are copied to Bitbucket when using delegated LDAP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Bitbucket Server web UI currently does not provide alternative text tags for project avatar images. Per WCAG requirements (see [https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/images/decorative/]), decorative images must provide at least an empty alternative text (alt="") or designate the element role as presentation.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to https://<BITBUCKET_URL>/bitbucket/projects
 # Right click > inspect on project's avatar image

h3. Expected Results

The image's HTML includes an 'alt' attribute of null/blank

h3. Actual Results

The image's HTML has no alt attribute:

 !image-2019-04-25-10-33-56-858.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This UI design defect results in preventing certain organizations from allowing any Bitbucket Server pages with project or repository listings to be public-facing - resulting in this defect impeding public-private partnerships, and participation by these organizations' development teams in the open-source community.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project avatars do not include alternative text

fields.description:
Most common code review comments I've encountered are simple enough to solve it in the same file, just by swapping reviewed code with fixed one.

That begs for a feature for accepting reviewers changes into authors code without a need to whole "open IDE at this code fragment, change, commit, push, ask for review again, track all comments" flow.

What I'm suggesting is "submit a change request to PR" functionality:
1. reviewer can create a diff snippet by selecting a number of lines that need to be changed and changing it
2. after submitting it will be displayed similarly to comment, but with additional buttons "deny change" and "accept change"
3. after clicking "accept change" code will be changed in the repository (using credentials of the reviewer)
4. accepting change will trigger another build (and all jenkins/tests/hooks configured for PR creation)
5. after clicking "deny change" snippet will turn gray and the only button left on it will be "unblock" (and short information about snippet being denied)

!image-2019-04-25-16-24-32-973.png!

!image-2019-04-25-16-43-16-602.png!

I think that this feature will increase the efficiency of teams working with pull requests policy and greatly increase the popularity of Bitbucket among developers.
fields.summary: PR change request

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition

When there is an Application Link between a Jira Software instance and a Bitbucket Server instance, comments in Bitbucket in the format of an issue key are automatically turned into a hyperlink, regardless of if the issue exists in the linked Jira. Clicking the link of non-existent Jira issues results in the following message:

!image-2019-04-19-13-50-22-697.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggested solution

On page render, reference the associated Jira Application Links to determine if an issue key exists that matches the issue key format that is currently matched against. 

If the issue exists in one of the linked Jira instances, generate the hyperlink. 

If not, do not generate the hyperlink - and leave that portion of the comment as plaintext.

h4. Workaround

None - disregard generated Jira issue links to issues that do not exist.

h4. Why this is important

The current behavior causes confusion for customers who are referencing a system outside of their linked Jira instance that uses a similar naming structure for the other system they're referencing.
fields.summary: Do not create Jira key links in comments if key does not exist

fields.description: JIRA offers an RSS feed for notifications. While I would ideally prefer to get Bitbucket notifications in Slack, my company doesn't support it. Having an RSS feed would be a great way to plug in any client to get notifications.

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition

When an application link is in place between Bitbucket Server and a Jira Software instance - when a linked Jira issue is clicked in Bitbucket, the summary of the Jira issue only contains the following four fields in addition to the issue description:
 * Type
 * Status
 * Priority
 * Assignee

Any other custom fields are not displayed.

Ex:

!image-2019-04-18-17-28-50-419.png|thumbnail!
h4. Suggested solution

Allow either the ability to add custom fields to the Jira issue summaries when viewed from Bitbucket, or allow the ability to customize which fields are shown. Ideally the ability to customize this would be based on the issue type.
h4. Workaround

Navigate out of Bitbucket, and review the missing fields within Jira for further information.
fields.summary: Allow ability to customize fields shown in linked Jira issue summary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket Data Center had a path traversal vulnerability in the Data Center migration tool. A remote attacker with authenticated user with admin permissions can exploit this path traversal vulnerability to write files to arbitrary locations which can lead to remote code execution on systems that run a vulnerable version of Bitbucket Data Center. Bitbucket Server versions without a Data Center license are not vulnerable to this vulnerability.

Affected versions of Bitbucket Data Center:
 * 5.13.0 <= version < 5.13.6
 * 5.14.0 <= version < 5.14.4
 * 5.15.0 <= version < 5.15.3
 * 5.16.0 <= version < 5.16.3
 * 6.0.0 <= version < 6.0.3
 * 6.1.0 <= version 6.1.2

h3. *What You Need to Do*

Atlassian recommends that you upgrade to the latest version. For a full description of the latest version of Bitbucket Data Center, see the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-6-1-release-notes-966687591.html]. You can download the latest version of Bitbucket Data Center from the [download centre.|https://www.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/download/data-center]

 

*Upgrade Bitbucket Data Center to version 6.1.2 or higher.*

If you are running *Bitbucket Data Center 5.13.x* and *cannot upgrade to 6.1.2*  *then* *upgrade to version 5.13.6.*

If you are running *Bitbucket Data Center 5.14.x* and *cannot upgrade to 6.1.2* *then* *upgrade to version 5.14.4.*

If you are running *Bitbucket Data Center 5.15.x* and *cannot upgrade to 6.1.2* *then* *upgrade to version 5.15.3.*

If you are running *Bitbucket Data Center 5.16.x* and *cannot upgrade to 6.1.2* *then* *upgrade to version 5.16.3.*

If you are running *Bitbucket Data Center 6.0.x* and *cannot upgrade to 6.1.2* *then* *upgrade to version 6.0.3.*
h3. *Mitigation*

The import functionality can be disabled via a feature flag, which would mitigate this vulnerability. This can be done by setting the property {{feature.data.center.migration.import=false}} in {{bitbucket.properties}}. Note that the export functionality would still work in this case. Bitbucket Server must then be restarted for changes to become effective.

If an import task still needs to be run, enable the feature on an isolated cluster node (inaccessible by users and admins but still connected to the cluster and accessible by sysadmins) with a node-local {{bitbucket.properties}} file where the property {{feature.data.center.migration.import=true}} is set. Imports can then be started by talking to this node directly while it would still be disabled on other nodes.

 

For additional details, see the full advisory: 

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-data-center-path-traversal-in-the-migration-tool-rce-cve-2019-3397-969526871.html]
fields.summary: Bitbucket Data Center - Path traversal in the migration tool leads to RCE - CVE-2019-3397

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the administrator is setting the user directory with a type "Read-only with local groups" and then decide to switch to Read-only the full synchronization still keeps the users in the local groups.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Bitbucket to the remote LDAP (reproduced with AD)
# Set the LDAP Permissions to *Read-Only, with local groups*
# Perform the synchronization
# Create the group
# Add the user to the newly created group
# Go to the settings of the directory and change to "*Read Only*"
# Perform Full synchronization

h3. Expected Results
The user from the directory will belong only to the groups from it's own directory
h3. Actual Results
The user belongs to the local group he/she has been assigned before the directory change

h3. Notes
The issue could be complex to discover if there are more than one external directory has been changed from Read-Only, with local groups to Read-Only.

h3. Workaround
Instead of changing of the type, remove and create a connector from scratch.
fields.summary: Changing the user directory type from Read-Only with local groups to Read-Only does not remove the users from local groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With Bitbucket DC AWS CF templates, when the NFS server is stoped and started, ZFS shares are not be available.So the new instances which are created with auto-scaling doesn't have Bitbucket installed and started and cause existing nodes also to fail.

h3. Environment

AWS - [Bitbucket Data Center on AWS - Quick Start|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/bitbucket/]

Fairly easy to reproduce.
 - Set the min node and max node in CF template.
 - Once the instance is up, restart NFS server.
 - Login to NFS server and check ZFS shares available or not. 
{code:java}
[ec2-user@ip-10-x-x-x ~]$ showmount -e
Export list for ip-x-x-x-:
[ec2-user@ip-10-x-x-x ~]$ 
{code}

 - Above output shows shares not available
 - Even starting ZFS share with sudo /etc/init.d/zfs-share start won't make the shares available. Service should be stoped and started again. See the *Workaround*
 - New nodes will not have Bitbucket server running.

h3. Expected Results

When the NFS server is restarted, it should enable ZFS shares as well. Also, when new nodes are created, bitbucket should be running there and should be part of the cluster.
h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket is not installed on new nodes and ZFS shares not available.
h3. Workaround

If the NFS server is restarted
{noformat}
[ec2-user@ip-10-x-x-x ~]$ sudo /etc/init.d/zfs-share stop
[ec2-user@ip-10-x-x-x ~]$ sudo /etc/init.d/zfs-share start
To check the share availability run below
[ec2-user@ip-10-x-x-x ~]$ showmount -e
Export list for ip-x-x-x-:
/media/atl *
{noformat}
fields.summary: With Bitbucket Server AWS QS templates, if NFS server is restarted new instance created don't have application running and ZFS shares NOT available

fields.description:
When configuring permissions in Bitbucket Server, in addition to being able to grant specific permissions to individual users, administrators can grant permissions to groups to implicitly grant them to all of a group's users. For performance, since permissions are checked frequently, Bitbucket Server maintains caches for user permissions (which covers only permissions granted to the user specifically) and group permissions.

The current approach for caching group permissions includes an entry for every group (up to the configured limit, which defaults to 2500), _even if some groups have no granted permissions._ For instances with a large number of groups, that can be extremely wasteful, and it can lead to cache churn that renders the group permission cache essentially useless.

Rather than caching permissions for every group, the system should only cache permissions for groups that _actually have some_. That will make much better use of the cache's allotted entries, and should greatly reduce churn. It should also mean many, if not most, instances that have large numbers of groups still don't need to significantly increase the group cache limit, since most groups likely do not have any granted permissions.
fields.summary: Only cache permissions for groups that actually have permissions granted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading to 5.16.x, the application logs contain a {{git-upload-pack}} message.

{noformat}
2019-04-07 11:18:20,257 WARN [ssh-scm-request-handler] 2aae8be9f4e1c695 *1WVLUW5x678x6222x1 uir0m7 142.136.201.251 SSH - git-upload-pack '/techmobile/server.git' c.a.s.i.s.g.p.s.CachingSshUploadPack TECHMOBILE/server[225]: git-upload-pack did not complete. It will be assumed the command failed
{noformat}

This appears to be a manifestation of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-11330  but customers that have upgraded to 5.16.x still see the warnings. 

(i) Apart from this warning message in the logs, there don't seem to be any issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce

It can be reproduced intermittently by performing multiple concurrent git fetches of the same repository at the same time over the ssh protocol and when it's either a {{cache:miss}} or a {{cache:bypass}} (ref advertisement cache is not enabled).

h3. Expected Results

No warning message should appear in the application logs.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bitbucket.log}} file:
{noformat}
2019-04-07 11:18:20,257 WARN [ssh-scm-request-handler] 2aae8be9f4e1c695 *1WVLUW5x678x6222x1 uir0m7 142.136.201.251 SSH - git-upload-pack '/techmobile/server.git' c.a.s.i.s.g.p.s.CachingSshUploadPack TECHMOBILE/server[225]: git-upload-pack did not complete. It will be assumed the command failed
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

These can be turned off using a REST API call (without the need of a restart), but users will lose the visibility that they have been turned off and miss new warnings in the future. For this reason our recommendation is to add the following to the bitbucket.properties file and restart or let the next restart apply the new setting:

{noformat}
logging.logger.com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.protocol.ssh.CachingSshUploadPack=ERROR
{noformat}
This line is increasing the log level from WARN to ERROR.

The API workaround only applies until Bitbucket is stopped, upon restart the values in the bitbucket.properties or the defaults apply.

This is the endpoint to use for changing the log level to ERROR:
{code}
curl -u <USER> -v -X PUT -d "" -H "Content-Type: application/json" <BITBUCKET URL>/rest/api/latest/logs/logger/com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.protocol.ssh.CachingSshUploadPack/error
{code}
fields.summary: git-upload-pack warning even after upgrading to 5.16.x

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Jira issue from Bitbucket Pull Request, Bitbucket does not retain the default field values for standard or custom fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a custom default field value for Priority field. I set to 'High' as 'Highest is the default'
 # Create a custom field in Jira and define a default value
 # Create a Jira issue from Jira to confirm the default values
 # From the Bitbucket Pull Request, create a Jira issue

h3. Expected Results

In the modal window, the Priority field should default to your custom value and your custom field should show your default value.

h3. Actual Results

The Priority displayed is the first in the list. 

My custom field shows "none". 

 !Create_Issue_-_Test_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

 !Pull_Request__1__adding_a_glass_-_Bitbucket-primary.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Update 13/11/2019 AEDT:

This bug can also manifest in custom fields not displaying their original values when transitioning tickets from within the Bitbucket.
I.e. instead of the original values assigned to the fields in the JRIA ticket, BItbucket modal window will show them as blank.

The bug fix seems to address this issue as well.
fields.summary: Bitbucket does not retrieve the default values for Jira fields

h3. Issue Summary
Trying to set SSH Base URL with these two parameters:
plugin.ssh.baseurl=
plugin.ssh.port=
has no effect on the SSH baseurl configuration. GUI doesn't display new base url, REST call ssh/1.0/settings doesn't return new baseurl as well.
h3. Environment
Tested on: Bitbucket 6.x (tested up to 6.1), Bitbucket 5.15
(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Stop Bitbucket Server.
Add:
plugin.ssh.baseurl=ssh://samplebaseurl
plugin.ssh.port=<sample_port_number>
to bitbucket.properties file.
Start Bitbucket Server.
h3. Expected Results
SSH Base url is updated and visible in GUI.

fields.description:
Often I would like to check out a branch based on looking at something in bitbucket. However, sometimes the branch name is long and i cannot type all of it or even see all of it in the dropdown menu. 

The 'Commits' and 'Branches' pages have an option called 'Copy Branch Name'. However, it is very hard to get to either of these pages from the dashboard. The only way to get to a branch if you want to copy it is to type it in. Which if I am typing it in I usually don't need to copy it.

I would request to add this 'Copy Branch Name' feature to the Dashboard.

It would be really nice to have it on the 'Create Pull Request' page too. Really anywhere that there is a drop down menu full of branches. I have attached a couple screenshots.
fields.summary: 'Copy Branch Name' option not available from many views

fields.description:
Currently, when visiting a project's repository list (ex: [http://examplebitbucketinstance.com/projects/PROJECTID|http://mybitbucket.com/projects/PROJECTNAME]) if more than ~25 repositories are in a given project, the list does not display all repositories at once - and it will iteratively load the repositories as you scroll down the page. This can make navigating through the list cumbersome when there are many repositories under a given project.

The request here is to allow administrators to configure this behavior to instead load all repositories at once when visiting the project's repository list. This will allow for easier scrolling on this page, albeit at the cost of an increased initial page load time while the system retrieves the listing of all repositories.
fields.summary: Option to load all repositories at once on project repository list

fields.description:
h3. Feature request

As an administrator, I would like the ability to send a broadcast email to all users. There should some kind 'email all users' feature that allow administrators to make announcement on the server.
h3. Use cases
 - Bitbucket Server will be offline for an extended or indefinite period of time and I need to notify users before it goes offline
 -- e.g. My Bitbucket Server instance is moving to a new domain and I need to notify all users of the instance to update their bookmarks / git remotes / etc.
 -- e.g. Bitbucket Server will be down for maintenance over the weekend and I need to notify all users so that there is a status page I can refer them to about the maintenance.
 - I need to notify all users of Bitbucket Server, including the users that do not log in to the web interface frequently
 -- e.g. We have switched to a new SSO provider and you will now need to use new login details to access Bitbucket Server.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like the ability to send a broadcast email to all users

When installing Bitbucket 6.1.2, the installer shows the message below if an unsupported GIT version is detected for this specific release:

 

!image-2019-04-03-11-57-01-720.png!

Checking on the suggested link ([http://go.atlassian.com/installgit]) for more information, under _Install or upgrade Git on Windows_, it says "Download the latest stable Git release from the [Git website"|http://git-scm.com/download/win]. However, [this link|http://git-scm.com/download/win] points to an incompatible version of GIT (the latest GIT 2.21.x) and the page starts to automatically download the latest GIT version, which is not compatible with Bitbucket to 6.1.x versions.

Instead the link above, it could be used the [https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/tag|https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/tags] [s |https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/tags]on which are listed supportable GIT versions for this Bitbucket release.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Pushing via a Smart Mirror over SSH vs HTTP has very different behaviour:
* SSH pushes are tunnelled through the mirror to the upstream server
* HTTP pushes redirect the client directly to the upstream server
Customers may find the behaviour of SSH pushes desirable in all circumstances: it enables the upstream server to be firewalled off externally, so that developers outside of the VPN cannot access it but can still perform git operations; and in cases where the mirror and upstream server have high bandwidth direct links (e.g. if both are hosted on different AWS regions) pushing via a mirror can be faster than pushing directly

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of issuing a redirect for HTTP pushes to mirrors, tunnel them through the mirror similarly to how SSH is handled

h3. Workaround
Use SSH only
fields.summary: Tunnel HTTP pushes to mirror through mirror instead of redirecting
